description:
Works to various trees on estate

Stuart Mill House, Killick Street:
T4, Horse Chestnut: Crown lift to 3m

T7, Whitebeam:  Dead. Fell, remove and replace.

Bonnington House, Killick Street:
T18, Wild Cherry:  Cut back split upright to sound timber, reduce and reshape remainder by 10 - 15%.  Lift to give 1m clearance from street lamp.
T25, Ash: Crown lift to 4m and tidy shape.
T26, Cherry: Crown lift to 4m and tidy shape.
T28, Ash:  Remove minor deadwood in crown and Crown thin 10%.
T30, Cherry:  Crown lift to 5m and tidy shape.

Priors (Manneby/Henley), Collier Street:
T42, Cherry: Dying, fell and remove stump
T43, Norway Maple: Crown reduce 30%
T44, Norway Maple: Crown reduce 30%

Priory Green, Collier Street side:
T54, Cherry:  Crown reduce 30% and crown lift to 4m.
T55, Cherry:  Crown reduce 30% and crown lift to 4m.
T57, Cherry:  Crown reduce 30% and crown lift to 4m.
T59, Lime:  Crown thin 20%, reduce over extended limb over entrance by up to 2m and crown lift to 4m.
T94, Field Maple: Crown lift to 3m.
T95, False Acacia: Dead.  Fell remove stump and replace.
T105, Ash: Crown lift to 4m and reduce away from lamp to give 1m clearance
T107, Ash:  Crown lift to 4m.
T132 a-d: Pines: Crown lift to 3m.
T141, Lime:  Crown lift to 4m.
T142, Horse Chestnut:  Reduce away from lamp to give 1m clearance, crown lift to 4m and tidy shape.

Priory Green, Calshot Street side:
T61, Wild Cherry:  Remove deadwood in crown lift to 4m and tidy.
T62, Norway Maple: Crown reduce 30%, crown lift to 4m and tidy.
T64, Wild Cherry:  Remove basal growth/ suckers.
T65, Rowan:  Crown thin smallest leader, crown lift to 3m.
T67, Cherry:  Crown reduce 10% and Crown lift to 4m.
T72, Lime:  Crown lift 4m and shape.
T82, False acacia: Fell, remove and replant with similar species.
T86, False Acacia: Remove deadwood, reduce from building to give 2.5m clearance.
T87, Ash:  Remove dead wood in crown.
T88, False Acacia: Re-stake.
T240, Ash: Crown lift to 3m.
decision_conditions: Replacement planting of all removals encouraged.
